intro: Jacquinia robusta, commonly known as the roughleaf bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and has lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture. Its flowers are usually blue to purple in color and bloom in late spring to early summer. Jacquinia robusta is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in supporting local pollinators.
